input:
Original Provision: 'States shall endeavor to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions.'

Identified Flaw: NON-BINDING LANGUAGE - The word 'endeavor' creates no legal obligation; states can claim they tried without achieving any reduction.
target: States shall reduce their aggregate greenhouse gas emissions by at least [X] percent below [baseline year] levels by [target year], as verified through annual reporting to the Secretariat.

input:
Original Provision: 'Each Party shall take appropriate measures to protect personal data processed by AI systems.'

Identified Flaw: VAGUE STANDARD - 'Appropriate measures' is undefined, allowing parties to claim compliance with minimal effort.
target: Each Party shall implement data protection measures that include: (a) encryption of personal data at rest and in transit; (b) access controls limiting data access to authorized personnel; (c) data minimization ensuring only necessary data is collected; (d) regular security audits at least annually; and (e) breach notification within 72 hours of discovery.

input:
Original Provision: 'States Parties may conduct inspections of declared facilities.'

Identified Flaw: PERMISSIVE LOOPHOLE - 'May' makes inspections optional, undermining verification. States can simply choose not to inspect.
target: States Parties shall conduct inspections of all declared facilities at least once every [12] months. The inspected Party shall provide access within [48] hours of notification and shall not impede or delay inspection activities.

input:
Original Provision: 'Member States shall notify the Organization of significant trade measures.'

Identified Flaw: UNDEFINED THRESHOLD - 'Significant' is not defined, allowing states to avoid notification by claiming measures are not significant.
target: Member States shall notify the Organization within [30] days of adopting any trade measure that: (a) affects imports or exports valued at more than [USD 10 million] annually; (b) applies to more than [5] percent of trade in a product category; or (c) imposes new quantitative restrictions or licensing requirements.

input:
Original Provision: 'Parties shall cooperate to prevent the illicit transfer of conventional weapons.'

Identified Flaw: NO ENFORCEMENT MECHANISM - 'Cooperate' requires no specific actions; parties can claim cooperation while taking no concrete steps.
target: Parties shall: (a) establish national contact points for information exchange within [90] days of entry into force; (b) respond to requests for information from other Parties within [30] days; (c) conduct joint risk assessments of identified trafficking routes annually; and (d) report seizures and interdictions to the Secretariat within [7] days of occurrence.

input:
Original Provision: 'AI systems should be designed to be explainable to users.'

Identified Flaw: NON-BINDING AND VAGUE - 'Should' is hortatory, and 'explainable' lacks technical specification.
target: AI systems that make decisions affecting individuals' rights or access to services shall provide explanations that include: (a) the principal factors contributing to the decision; (b) the relative weight of each factor; (c) information in plain language comprehensible to the affected individual; and (d) a mechanism for the individual to request human review within [30] days.

input:
Original Provision: 'Each State Party undertakes to pursue negotiations in good faith on effective measures relating to nuclear disarmament.'

Identified Flaw: INDEFINITE TIMELINE - No deadline or milestones; states can 'pursue negotiations' indefinitely without progress.
target: Each State Party shall: (a) submit a plan for nuclear disarmament measures within [2] years of entry into force; (b) commence negotiations on specific disarmament measures within [3] years; (c) achieve at least one binding disarmament agreement within [10] years; and (d) report progress to the Review Conference every [5] years.

input:
Original Provision: 'Parties shall ensure that their domestic laws are consistent with this Convention.'

Identified Flaw: NO IMPLEMENTATION TIMELINE - No deadline for bringing laws into conformity; indefinite delay possible.
target: Parties shall bring their domestic laws into conformity with this Convention within [2] years of ratification. Each Party shall submit a compliance report to the Committee within [6] months of this deadline, identifying all legislative measures adopted and any remaining gaps with a remediation plan.

input:
Original Provision: 'Developed country Parties shall provide financial resources to assist developing country Parties.'

Identified Flaw: NO MINIMUM COMMITMENT - Amount of assistance is entirely discretionary; could be token amounts.
target: Developed country Parties shall collectively provide financial resources of at least [USD 100 billion] annually to assist developing country Parties. Each developed country Party shall contribute a share proportional to its gross national income, with a minimum contribution of [0.7] percent of GNI.

input:
Original Provision: 'States shall investigate allegations of torture promptly.'

Identified Flaw: UNDEFINED TIMEFRAME - 'Promptly' has no specific meaning; investigations can be delayed indefinitely.
target: States shall commence investigation of all credible allegations of torture within [48] hours of receipt. Investigations shall be completed within [90] days unless extension is approved by an independent judicial authority. Findings shall be communicated to the complainant within [14] days of completion.

input:
Original Provision: 'Parties shall take steps to conserve biological diversity within their jurisdiction.'

Identified Flaw: DISCRETIONARY ACTION - 'Take steps' allows minimal symbolic action without measurable outcomes.
target: Parties shall: (a) designate at least [17] percent of terrestrial and [10] percent of marine areas as protected zones by [target year]; (b) establish biodiversity monitoring systems covering all designated areas; (c) report species population trends annually; and (d) achieve net-zero biodiversity loss by [target year] as measured against [baseline year] assessments.

input:
Original Provision: 'High-risk AI systems shall undergo conformity assessment before being placed on the market.'

Identified Flaw: SELF-ASSESSMENT LOOPHOLE - Does not specify independent assessment; allows providers to certify themselves.
target: High-risk AI systems shall undergo conformity assessment by an accredited independent third-party body before being placed on the market. The assessment shall include: (a) technical documentation review; (b) testing against published standards; (c) on-site audit of development processes; and (d) annual re-certification for systems remaining on the market.

input:
Original Provision: 'Nothing in this Agreement shall prevent a Party from adopting measures it considers necessary for the protection of its essential security interests.'

Identified Flaw: SELF-JUDGING EXCEPTION - 'It considers necessary' makes the exception entirely subjective with no review.
target: A Party invoking essential security interests shall: (a) notify the Council within [7] days specifying the interest and measure; (b) demonstrate the measure is proportionate to the identified threat; (c) submit to good offices of the Council if another Party objects; and (d) terminate the measure within [30] days of the threat ceasing. Invocation shall not be available for economic or commercial disputes.

input:
Original Provision: 'States Parties shall take effective measures to prevent non-state actors from acquiring weapons of mass destruction.'

Identified Flaw: NO SPECIFIC OBLIGATIONS - 'Effective measures' is undefined; states can claim any measure is effective.
target: States Parties shall: (a) criminalize WMD acquisition by non-state actors with penalties of at least [20] years imprisonment; (b) establish export controls on all materials listed in Annex I; (c) conduct background checks on personnel with access to controlled materials; (d) implement physical security standards at all facilities handling controlled materials; and (e) report to the Committee annually on enforcement actions taken.

input:
Original Provision: 'Service suppliers shall be accorded treatment no less favourable than that accorded to like service suppliers of any other Party.'

Identified Flaw: UNDEFINED LIKENESS - 'Like service suppliers' is contested; parties can argue suppliers are not 'like' to deny equal treatment.
target: Service suppliers shall be accorded treatment no less favourable than that accorded to service suppliers of any other Party operating in the same service sector and sub-sector. Determination of 'same sector' shall be based on the W/120 Services Sectoral Classification List. Differences in corporate form, ownership structure, or country of incorporation shall not be grounds for differential treatment.
